comment.body:
The surface web have a lot of false-leftists saying "we are revolutionary".
This makes anyone sad.
I'm not a anarchist, but for me the majority of people of a country having the power that politicals have, is the true democracy and the system I dream for. Will be nice to hear your throughts.
@Kaffie: We voting for politicals that do anything they want, is like a anarchism. A true democracy is the people voting for things, not voting for people.

@Mynameislegion: also, I believe the Internet and Bitcoin can solve it. We don't need quantum computers to have a proof-of-concept anti-tampering secure voting system, like some sell the idea. Yes, I believe the best system we can have is where anyone can propose new things and the majority of people need to vote for approvation.

@Mynameislegion: I believe this voting system can start in ZeroNet. Because this I've suggested here to have democratic functions:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/15XeFY67fYKCKxQPfeo246ELto2Gff1hAe/1490848996

@Mynameislegion: Sadly, the people receives a comfort zone, an reality-atmosphere where all inside it are considerated normal, and the things aside (the reality) are considerated abnormal. About ZeroNet, I think a good system can avoid attacks. I have a concept about it called Gitcratic. If you want to know more, you can ask and I'll post on my profile.
@Mynameislegion: Ok, I'll post it in my profile.
@Mynameislegion: Posted now my concepts for Gitcratic, a model that can also be implemented in ZeroNet.
@Ivesen: I was thinking on reply when you come and commented.

@Kaffie: I think Snifferdog did a enough sound. Good to see now Kaffiene is open-source.
@mkg20001: How will be Zule after this announcement? I'm fine with moving Snifferdog's ideas to Kaffiene.
Is ever good for the open-source community when 2 projects are merged. It make both stronger. I believe projects from communities can be greater than projects from companies.
